Basic details: Emily Johnson, an 11-year-old girl, comes to the clinic after an elevated glucose test was reported by the school nurse.
Vitals:
BP: 110/70 mm Hg
Temp: 98.4°F (36.9°C)
RR: 18/minute
HR: 88/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Sit quietly in the examination room, appearing slightly anxious.
Mention feeling more thirsty than usual and needing to use the bathroom more frequently.
If asked about diet, mention a recent increase in appetite but no significant weight gain.
If asked about family history, mention that a grandparent has diabetes.
Challenging question: "Does this mean I have diabetes? Will I need to take insulin shots?"
